title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 302.8 - Transportation of explosives and other dangerous substances
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 302.8 - Transportation of explosives and other dangerous substances

State Regulations

No person shall transport over the bridge or its approaches, any dynamite, nitroglycerin, black powder, fireworks, blasting caps or other
explosives, gasoline, alcohol, ether, liquid shellac, kerosene, turpentine, formaldehyde or other inflammable or combustible liquids, ammonium nitrate, sodium chlorate, wet hemp, powdered metallic magnesium, celluose, acetate film, peroxides or other readily flammable solids, or oxidizing materials, hydrochloric acid, sulfuric acid or other corrosive liquids, prussic acid, phosgene, arsenic, carbolic acid, potassium cyanide, tear gas, lewisite or any
other poisonous substances, liquids or gases, or any compressed gas, at such
time or place or in such manner or condition as to endanger unreasonably or as
to be likely to endanger unreasonably persons or property. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21

302.8

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
